messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: unschooling chat for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/28/2006 8:16:25 A.M. Central Standard Time, zoocrew@wideopenwest.com writes: have a  new to unschooling 16-year-old that is interested in
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/28/2006 8:16:25 A.M. Central Standard Time,
zoocrew@... writes:

have a new to unschooling 16-year-old that is interested in this as
well. My son,12 and unschooling for years, may be interested if he
could find boys his age to talk about gaming and such.



Someone may have mentioned this already, but I'd recommend getting to an
unschooling conference if at all possible. The kids have such a wonderful time
and make great connections there.

I have a 12 year old son very into gaming and a 16 year old daughter (not
into gaming) but a big proponent of unschooling. They both love to IM
friends.

Have you considered going to the Live and Learn Conference in Albuquerque
this fall?

Gail


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: unschooling chat for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: Tina, I have a 15 year old and we are new as well.  I am sure he would be interested to chat with your 16 yo. Thanks, Faith ... From: Tina To:
messages.messageBody:
Tina,

I have a 15 year old and we are new as well. I am sure he would be interested to chat with your 16 yo.

Thanks,
Faith
----- Original Message -----
From: Tina
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, February 28, 2006 9:09 AM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Re: unschooling chat for kids?


>>They would love to be able to communicate with other UNschoolers.
They tell me they don't miss school at all but that they do wish there
were more unschoolers around to talk to.>>

I have a new to unschooling 16-year-old that is interested in this as
well. My son,12 and unschooling for years, may be interested if he
could find boys his age to talk about gaming and such.

Tina

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] unschooling chat for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/27/2006 5:43:51 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Hi Melanie, My daughters are ALWAYS asking this sort of question. They are, soon to be 11
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/27/2006 5:43:51 PM Eastern Standard Time,
us5@... writes:


> I know another post so soon. My daughter was just reading over my shoulder
> and asked if
> there are other groups like this for kids, so she could talk to other new
> unschoolers about
> HER concerns? Any ideas, she has never been in a "chat room" and really
> doesn't use the
> computer much, but if it was safe i would encourage it. Thanks again Melanie
> in VT
>
>

Hi Melanie,
My daughters are ALWAYS asking this sort of question. They are, soon to be 11
(April 2) and 12. I was always concerned about the safety issues also, but I
too would encourage if I knew it was safe. They would love to be able to
communicate with other UNschoolers. They tell me they don't miss school at all but
that they do wish there were more unschoolers around to talk to.

Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: unschooling chat for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: I know another post so soon.  My daughter was just reading over my shoulder and asked if there are other groups like this for kids, so she could talk to other
messages.messageBody:
I know another post so soon. My daughter was just reading over my shoulder and asked if
there are other groups like this for kids, so she could talk to other new unschoolers about
HER concerns? Any ideas, she has never been in a "chat room" and really doesn't use the
computer much, but if it was safe i would encourage it. Thanks again Melanie in VT
